wikipedia_page.main: Robert Popham Spurway (16 July 1866 – 4 December 1898) was an English cricketer who made 20 first-class appearances for Natal and Somerset County Cricket Club.  He was a right-handed batsman and a right-arm off break bowler.  His best season was in 1894, when he played six times, scoring 223 at an average of 24.77.

link_mentions.page: List of Somerset County Cricket Club players

response: The Spurway family had close connections with Somerset County Cricket Club; Edward's father was noted in his Wisden Cricketers' Almanack obituary as being "a well-known member" of the club, while two of his sons, Francis Edward and Michael Vyvyan played first-class cricket for the county, as did his brother, Robert Spurway.
